page.title: 06ROADS AND TRAFFIC
page.content: One{main road,}the A22, runs North South through the village of South Godstone. Other roads in the area are{ mainly{country lanes}bordered by crop fields and pasture land. The country lanes are not particularly well kept and the banks and hedges get very overgrown. {Traffic}is heavy on the main road with as many as 604 cars and lorries travelling towards London during the morning rush hour. During the summer and at fine weekends holiday traffic travels south towards the coast. In the village there are no parking facilities for those occupying Evelyn Cottages which means cars are parked along the main road itself. Lorries are parked constantly outside the shops making it hazardous for vehicles to join the main road from Hunters Chase.
